item.description:
Customer management endpoints for tracking salon clients.

Access Control:
- GET /api/customers - OWNER and RECEPTIONIST ‚úÖ
- GET /api/customers/:id - OWNER and RECEPTIONIST ‚úÖ
- POST /api/customers - OWNER and RECEPTIONIST ‚úÖ
- PUT /api/customers/:id - OWNER and RECEPTIONIST ‚úÖ
- DELETE /api/customers/:id - OWNER only ‚úÖ
- GET /api/customers/search - OWNER and RECEPTIONIST ‚úÖ

Customer Fields:
- name (required): Customer's full name
- phoneNumber (required): Primary contact number
- email (optional): Email address
- address (optional): Physical address
- notes (optional): Additional notes about the customer
- totalAppointments (auto): Total number of appointments
- totalSpent (auto): Total amount spent
- lastVisit (auto): Date of last appointment

item.name: Appointments

request.description: Get all appointments sorted by date. Requires OWNER or RECEPTIONIST role.
Get today's appointments (excludes CANCELLED). Requires OWNER or RECEPTIONIST role.
Get a single appointment by ID. Requires OWNER or RECEPTIONIST role.

Create a new appointment. Requires OWNER or RECEPTIONIST role.

Required fields:
- customerId (MongoDB ObjectId)
- staffId (MongoDB ObjectId)
- serviceIds (Array of MongoDB ObjectIds - at least one service required)
- appointmentDate (ISO8601 date string)

Optional fields:
- status (SCHEDULED, CONFIRMED, IN_PROGRESS, COMPLETED, CANCELLED, NO_SHOW - default: SCHEDULED)
- notes

Note: Duration and price are automatically calculated as the sum of all selected services.

Update an appointment. Requires OWNER or RECEPTIONIST role. All fields are optional.

If services are changed, duration and price are automatically recalculated as the sum of all selected services.
Cancel an appointment (soft delete - sets status to CANCELLED). Requires OWNER or RECEPTIONIST role.

item.description:
Appointment management endpoints.

Access Control:
- GET /api/appointments - OWNER and RECEPTIONIST ‚úÖ
- GET /api/appointments/today - OWNER and RECEPTIONIST ‚úÖ
- GET /api/appointments/:id - OWNER and RECEPTIONIST ‚úÖ
- POST /api/appointments - OWNER and RECEPTIONIST ‚úÖ
- PUT /api/appointments/:id - OWNER and RECEPTIONIST ‚úÖ
- DELETE /api/appointments/:id - OWNER and RECEPTIONIST ‚úÖ

Appointment Statuses:
- SCHEDULED: Appointment is scheduled but not confirmed
- CONFIRMED: Appointment is confirmed by customer
- IN_PROGRESS: Service is currently being provided
- COMPLETED: Service has been completed
- CANCELLED: Appointment was cancelled
- NO_SHOW: Customer did not show up

Appointment Fields:
- customer (required): Reference to Customer
- staff (required): Reference to Staff Member
- services (required): Array of references to Services (at least one required)
- appointmentDate (required): Date and time of appointment
- duration (auto): Sum of all service durations
- price (auto): Sum of all service prices
- status (optional): Default is SCHEDULED
- notes (optional): Additional notes
- createdBy (auto): User who created the appointment

Multiple Services:
Appointments support multiple services per booking. For example, a customer can book a haircut and coloring in one appointment. The total duration and price are automatically calculated.

item.name: Revenue

query.description: Year to get trends for (optional, defaults to current year)

request.description:
**Yearly Revenue Trends** - Get all 12 months of revenue data for a specific year. Requires OWNER role.

Use this for:
- Annual reports
- Year-over-year comparisons
- Viewing revenue patterns across a full year

**Returns:**
Array of 12 months with revenue and appointment count for each:
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "year": 2026,
  "data": [
    { "month": "Jan", "monthNumber": 1, "revenue": 500, "appointmentCount": 1 },
    { "month": "Feb", "monthNumber": 2, "revenue": 0, "appointmentCount": 0 },
    ...
  ]
}
```

**Query Parameters:**
- year: Specific year (e.g., 2026) - optional, defaults to current year

**Examples:**
- Current year: /api/revenue/trends
- Specific year: /api/revenue/trends?year=2026

**ALL-IN-ONE Revenue Endpoint** - Get complete revenue data for a month. Requires OWNER role.

**Filter Options:**
- No params (default): Current month
- ?filter=current: Current month
- ?filter=last: Last month
- ?month=3: Specific month in current year (March)
- ?month=3&year=2026: Specific month and year (March 2026)

**Complete Response Includes:**
1. period: Month details (name, number, year, date range)
2. summary: totalRevenue, totalAppointments, uniqueCustomers, averages
3. revenueByStaff: Breakdown by each staff member (sorted by revenue)
4. revenueByCategory: Breakdown by service category (sorted by revenue)
5. dailyBreakdown: Day-by-day revenue within the month
6. appointments: All completed appointments with full details

**Use Cases:**
- Dashboard overview: One call gets all data
- Monthly reports: Complete month analysis
- Staff performance: See top earners
- Category insights: Best performing services

**Examples:**
- Current month: /api/revenue/monthly
- Last month: /api/revenue/monthly?filter=last
- January 2026: /api/revenue/monthly?month=1&year=2026

item.description:
Revenue reporting and analytics endpoints. All revenue endpoints require OWNER role and only count COMPLETED appointments.

**Access Control:**
- GET /api/revenue/trends - OWNER only ‚úÖ (Yearly overview: 12 months)
- GET /api/revenue/monthly - OWNER only ‚úÖ (All-in-one monthly revenue)

**Revenue Calculation:**
- Only COMPLETED appointments are counted in revenue
- Revenue is based on the appointment price (sum of all services)

**üìä Two Main Endpoints:**

1. **GET /api/revenue/monthly** ‚≠ê RECOMMENDED - All-in-One Monthly Revenue
   Use this for your dashboard! Returns EVERYTHING in one call:
   - Summary metrics (total revenue, appointments, customers, averages)
   - Revenue by staff (sorted by earnings)
   - Revenue by category (sorted by earnings)
   - Daily breakdown (day-by-day for the month)
   - Full appointments list
   
   Filter Options:
   - No params: Current month (default)
   - ?filter=current: Current month
   - ?filter=last: Last month
   - ?month=1&year=2026: Specific month (January 2026)

2. **GET /api/revenue/trends** - Yearly Overview
   Returns all 12 months of revenue data for a specific year.
   Use this for annual reports and year-over-year comparisons.
   - ?year=2026: Get all 12 months of 2026
   - No params: Current year

**Quick Start:**
```
# Get current month revenue (all data)
GET /api/revenue/monthly

# Get last month revenue
GET /api/revenue/monthly?filter=last

# Get January 2026 revenue
GET /api/revenue/monthly?month=1&year=2026

# Get yearly overview (12 months)
GET /api/revenue/trends?year=2026
```
